page.title: 10Hotels in Hungerford.
page.content:
The Bear dates back to the 13th century and has frequently attracted Royal patronage.This historical background plus the establishments' reputation for quality attracts many over sea visitors.No frozen food is served at the Bear but fresh produce from all over the British Isles is used.There are 28 rooms available for guests.
The Plume. Although situated in the High St.residents of the Plume do not have commoners rights.The first mention of the "Plume Public House" is in 1814 when the publican was Thomas Salter and the property was worth Â£25. Nowadays meals are served and on average 120 customers visit the Plume each day.
